did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: These papers contain the family files of Elena Iur'evna Iavorskaia, a Russian émigré, who lived in Switzerland after the Russian revolution, and include educational documents, genealogical files, and various certificates.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: Czech French Russian

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

originalsloc.head: Location of Original Materials
originalsloc.p: Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary, Jordanville, New York

chronitem.event: Born E. Iu. Naryshkina, Orel, Russia
College de Montreux, received Certifica d'Etudes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: These papers contain the family files of Elena Iur'evna Iavorskaia, a Russian émigré, who lived in Switzerland after the Russian revolution, and include educational documents, genealogical files, and various certificates.

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and the Holy Trinity Seminary. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials remain in the Holy Trinity Seminary Archives as its property. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is appended to this register. Any views, findings, conclusions or recommendations expressed in these materials do not necessarily represent those of the National Endowment for the Humanities.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into five series: Biographical file, Correspondence, Notes, Photographs, and Printed matter

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the online catalog.

scopecontent.p: Bibliography, biography, certificates, drawing, educational documents, family correspondence, financial documents, identification documents, medical documents, obituaries. Arranged alphabetically by physical form
Includes certificates of birth and death

did.unittitle: Iavorskaia, E. I., certificate of death, identification documents,

scopecontent.p: Includes bibliography, biography, certificates of baptism, and death, and educational documents

did.unittitle: Naryshkin, G. A. and S. V.,
Pencil drawing of Elena Iur'evna Iavorskaia by Archimandrite Kiprian (Pyzhov),

scopecontent.p: Cards and letters, arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent
Clippings from various émigré newspapers relating to general topics, as well as religion, and Russian history and culture. Not filmed. Originals retained by Holy Trinity Seminary
